title: ARC FLASH BOUNDARY
fullText:
The arc flash boundary is the distance from the arc source at which the incident energy equals 1.2 cal/cm2. This is the distance at which a person could receive a second degree burn if an arc flash were to occur.
The arc flash boundary shall be determined for all battery systems with a nominal voltage greater than DVC-A.
NOTE 1 The arc flash boundary may be determined by calculation or by reference to Appendix F.
NOTE 2 The arc flash boundary is used to determine the PPE requirements for personnel working on or near the battery system.
